newsitem.title: UK: Ofgas to review UK gas Network Code at end of Feb.
newsitem.headline: Ofgas to review UK gas Network Code at end of Feb.

text.p: UK gas industry regulator Ofgas is to hold a review at the end of February to assess the performance of the Network Code, the rule book governing trade on the deregulated domestic market, an Ofgas spokesman said on Monday.

"The code's worked well during the winter and everyone's getting their gas," he said. But he added that Ofgas had decided the code should be reviewed after the first six months since the "hard landing", when strict financial penalties for failing to observe all the provisions of the code, was introduced on September 1.
Ofgas could not say how long the review would take, although the spokesman added that it would be published on completion.

A total of 56 amendments to the code have already been added since it was introduced, with over 100 modifications proposed, but Ofgas was not surprised by this. "The whole idea is to include things we hadn't originally thought of," the spokesman said.

A spokeswoman for TransCo, the pipeline arm of British Gas Plc, which operates the National Transmission System, said that TransCo was involved in a number of workshops discussing the implementation of full domestic competition in 1998. One of the subjects under discussion was whether the code needed simplification.

"There are fears in the industry that the document is too complicated, although it is a complicated subject," she said. "It's not our code, it's everybody's code, and if the industry wants it simplified we'll look at ways to help simplify it."
